page.title: 01SADBERGE VILLAGE
page.content: { {Sadberge}is the only place in the world with this name which means{ {'Hill of Pleas',}the place where people came to make and answer to the law.It stands on a hill between {Stockton and Darlington,}it now has a population of between 600 and 700 people..You can see the Pennines to the West and the{Cleveland Hills}to the South East of the village.It is a very ancient place,the{Romans}had a fort here and a{Roman Road,Rynkneild {Street}runs through the centre of the village.It was a{Wapentake}in{Saxon} times.Sadberge used to be much}more important than either Darlington or Durham City.The main assizes were held here,there are the remains of the prison under the{Three Tuns public {house. By Daniel Shield<Aged11>
